intro: Melianthus dregeanus, commonly known as the wild pear or yellow star, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in a sticky, resinous substance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy plant in arid environments. The flowers are primarily visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
